Previous studies [ 9] have shown that high-performance transverse thermoelectric composites usually consist of one semiconducting thermoelectric phase and one highly conductive phase, where the thermoelectric phase provides high Seebeck coefficient and low thermal conductivity, the conducting phase provides low electrical resistivity.
